['Initiate  ', 'Undertake   ', 'Commence    ', 'Engage      ', 'Implement   ', 'Execute     ', 'Start       ', 'Proceed      ', 'Perform    ', 'Conduct    ', 'Administer ', 'Pocket watches - old-style wristwatches that are small and typically kept in the pocket  ', 'Ties (or Neckties) - long narrow pieces of fabric worn around the neck, tied together in front  ', 'Cravats - a formal neckband, skinny tie or neckcloth; historically, it is often knotted at the side and then brought across to the opposite shoulder before being brought back behind the neck  ', 'Suspenders (or Braces) - fabric straps worn over the shoulders to hold up trousers  ', 'Vest (or Waistcoat) - a sleeveless garment that is worn on top of a dress shirt, underneath a suit jacket or blazer  ', 'Cummerbunds - broad waist sashes worn with single-breasted dinner suits to cover the area between the outermost skirt and trousers  ', 'Pocket squares - decorative pieces of fabric placed in the breast pocket of a suit jacket or blazer for a touch of color and style  ', 'Dinner jackets (or Tuxedos) - formal evening jackets with satin lapel facings, often worn to black-tie events  ', 'Wing Collar Shirts - shirt collars with exaggerated wing shapes on either side for a more formal look when paired with ties or cravats  ', 'Dinner vests - sleeveless garments, often part of a black-tie ensemble; they are similar to cummerbunds but worn as an integral piece of the suit instead of a sash  ', 'Ascot Ties (or Ascots) - narrow ties with pointed ends and decorative bands at their centers or edges, traditionally made from silk  ', 'Bow Ties - neckties composed of fabric formed into a bow shape; they are often worn for formal occasions in lieu of traditional ties  ', "Cufflinks (or Button-less Shirt Cuffs) - decorative fasteners used to secure the cuffs of dress shirts when buttons aren't present or desired  ", 'Pocket Watch Chains - straps attached to pocket watches for securing them in a trouser pocket or attaching them to clothing, often ornate and made from precious metals  ', 'Tailcoat Suits (or White-Tie) - formal suits characterized by their fitted nature, tails at the back of the jacket, and typically worn for white-tie events']
